channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road full of pot holes been reported do you job, 17th February
item.description:
All along the road. I pay my tax i want it fixed in a timely manner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste outside property worsening vermin issue, 17th February
item.description:
The removal of a large hedge by the council adjacent to Number 6 Aysgarth Avenue, GL51 3RE has led to a vermin issue. The residents of No. 6 dump rubbish outside their property routinely and this is worsening vermin issue. The photos of current waste are much better than previous weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Aysgarth Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes, 17th February
item.description:
Several along the stretch between Lansdown Road and Shelley Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Kingsley Gardens, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Two large potholes, rubble being pushed onto the pavement by vehicles, 17th February
item.description:
Outside number 46.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Long Mynd Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: The single track road (dead end) is falling away, long pot hole strips, needs completely resurfacing, 17th February
item.description:
Green Lane, Gl3 4tz section, from the field gate by dog rubbish bin up to the entrance to Little Witcombe court park..poor condition along whole section. Gets worse with every rain runoff from the hills.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two temporary road closure signs totally obstructing vision when trying to enter main road from Shaw green lane. All neighbours very concerned.Required passenger to get out of car to see if cars approaching., 17th February
item.description:
End of Asha’s green lane onto main fast flowing Prestbury to Winchcombe road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: A deep pothole that you can’t avoid because of where it is without swerving, 17th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Potentially dangerous trees within highways verge, 17th February
item.description:
Tewkesbury inspector has checked Borough Council trees and found numerous ash with decay fungi. While onsite, they found similar decay issues on GCC highways trees. The hedge there has many dead trees as well. Recommend having highways tree inspector have a look so that maintenance can be arranged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Wallis Way, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still flooded, 17th February
item.description:
Stop marking cases as addressed. They haven't been addressed. Still a lake and dangerous to drive through. Sort it out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
